title: The Heart Of Crimea

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: According to our scouts, the enemy has split into two forces. One is east of the Ertz Mountains. The other is approaching from the north, by crossing through Crimea.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: So, they plan on flanking Gallia from the north and east. If we don't stop them, this is gonna hurt.

intro.speaker: Caineghis
intro.line: Agreed. What is the Crimean army doing?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: From what the scouts have said, nothing at all. I'm guessing they're waiting to see how everything pans out.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Crimea let Begnion pass without a fight?! What about their alliance with Gallia?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: It's not that simple, Skrimir. Begnion is Crimea's suzerain state. It's difficult for Crimea to refuse Begnion's demands.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: A suza-what? Someone explain to me what that means.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Hmm, how can I explain... All right, how's this? Begnion still holds political power over countries that won independence from them. Anything you want to add, Ike?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Don't look at me. I've always thought the whole idea was ridiculous.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Never mind what it means. Has Crimea broken its treaty with us?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Not...as such. I didn't say it was right, just that it was complicated...

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: It's not complicated at all! Crimea has betrayed Gallia! We cannot let this pass! How da--
Control yourself, Skrimir. You're acting like a fool.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: M-my apologies, Your Majesty. It is just--

intro.speaker: Caineghis
intro.line: I doubt that Crimea has sided with Begnion. Queen Elincia is very clever, and I will not stop trusting her judgment just yet. She most likely allowed the Imperial Army to pass through her lands in order to avoid a slaughter.

intro.speaker: Nailah
intro.line: Who is this beorc queen who warrants so much trust? Please, enlighten us.

intro.speaker: Caineghis
intro.line: She is a delightful woman, both in manner and in reign. Her late father, King Ramon, and I forged an alliance between beorc and laguz. We sought to bring our peoples closer. She has taken her father's ideals as her own and strives to create a country where anyone, beorc or laguz, can live free and in peace.

intro.speaker: Rafiel
intro.line: How times have changed... I never could have dreamed of a time where such a beorc ruler would exist. I must admit, I still have doubts.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: I don't blame you, my brother. Change has been slow, but the circle of acceptance in Tellius has been widening. As you can see, both Leanne and I have many beorc friends. Queen Elincia of Crimea is one of them.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Both the king and Reyson speak well of this woman! Is she truly so special?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: She truly is. But right now, that's beside the point. The most important thing is, Elincia will never betray her allies in Gallia.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: I couldn't agree more. We can trust her.

intro.speaker: Caineghis
intro.line: All right. Let's assume for now that Crimea will not aid the empire in any military fashion during this conflict. Hawk King, let's hear your thoughts.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Well, if Crimea won't make a move, then I see no reason to wait until the empire reaches Gallia. I'd prefer to take an army up north and end this mess for good.

intro.speaker: Caineghis
intro.line: Very well. Ike, do the Greil Mercenaries have anything to add?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: ...I agree with Tibarn's idea. We should strike while their army is split in half. I'm pretty sure that General Zelgius will be there, though. We'd better be careful.

intro.speaker: Caineghis
intro.line: Very well. Hawk King, may I ask that your forces protect the eastern border? While they do that, I would like you to lead our strike force to the northern border. Take Ranulf with you, as well.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Send me too, Your Majesty! Please, let me reclaim my honor! I beg you.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: I second that, Your Majesty. Skrimir is perfect for this mission.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Ranulf?

intro.speaker: Caineghis
intro.line: ...Very well. Will you look after him, Hawk King?

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Sure, I can handle him. He's easier to keep under control than you are, Lion King.

intro.speaker: Caineghis
intro.line: Hmph. He's all yours, then. Now, everyone. Prepare to leave before daybreak. We are all depending on you.

intro.speaker: Gallia
intro.line: Insects of Begnion! We'll show you the power of the beast tribe!

intro.speaker: Phoenicis
intro.line: Beorc scum! For the razing of our homes, we'll make you wish you'd never been born!

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Filthy sub-humans! This war ends now. Prepare yourselves!

intro.speaker: Gallia
intro.line: A beorc army is approaching from the hill to the left! That flag... It's the Crimean army!

intro.speaker: Gallia
intro.line: C-Crimea intends to side with the empire after all!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Elincia? What are you doing...

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: Uwee hee hee. Finally, they see the light and are coming to fight with us! Excellent. Took them long enough. I suppose when you have the brain of a gnat, these things take some time to sink in.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I am Queen Elincia of Crimea. I have a message for the commanders of both armies! I am here to declare the will of Crimea and its people! Crimea has been ruled under the ideals of peace and equality since the reign of my father, King Ramon. As such, I cannot and will not allow you to spill blood upon our land! Therefore...

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I demand that both the Laguz Alliance and the Imperial Army leave Crimea at once!

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: Withdraw our troops?! You foolish girl! We will not be ordered about by the proclamations of a peasant like you! Puppet rulers such as yourself should stay inside their pretty castles and play dress-up. Begnion's patience has worn out. After we finish slaughtering the sub-humans, we'll be coming for you in Melior.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Commander of the Laguz Alliance. How do you respond?

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: ...You have some serious guts, jumping into the middle of a battlefield all by yourself. But your high-and-mighty beliefs don't change the fact that Begnion must answer for its crimes. Step aside.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...Very well. I've heard from both commanders. Then--

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: This is Crimea's answer. We will not sway from our ideas. My countrymen stand united. We will not use force. But we are willing to do whatever it takes to end this here and now.

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: What?! Have you lost your mind?

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Heh...

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: ...Ha... Hahahahaha!  Ike, I thought you were the craziest beorc I'd ever met, but you have some serious competition! Crimea's queen is one tough woman... Your Majesty, I like your style! Skrimir! I can't let such a pretty woman down. Let's get out of here.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Of course. The beast tribe will not use our claws against unarmed beorc. Soldiers, back to the forest!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Thank you, King Tibarn.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: This is only temporary. The war between the Laguz Alliance and Begnion isn't finished yet.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Yes, I understand that. Even so, I want you all to know where Crimea stands in this.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: ...Hey, you and I should get together and chat sometime. I'll be seeing you again soon.

intro.speaker: Levail
intro.line: General Zelgius! What are your orders? Shall we launch an attack?

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: No. We will withdraw.

intro.speaker: Levail
intro.line: Are you certain, General?

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Could you cast aside your weapon while surrounded by armed soldiers?

intro.speaker: Levail
intro.line: I don't know, sir... No, probably not.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Queen Elincia has done something that even I would be hard pressed to do. For that, we must show our respect.

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: Stop this instant! Wait! Where do you think you're going?! Attack those mangy beasts!

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Please forgive my audacity. However, we are withdrawing. Every battle ebbs and flows. To go against these tides is unwise. Please understand, Senator.

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: You self-righteous fool... You'll understand something else, once we're through with this battle.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: I don't want to go back yet... Do we have time to talk to Elincia?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: It has been a long time since we last saw Queen Elincia. We should at least say hello.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Sure, sounds great to me. There's probably not much time for small talk, but we'll see.

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: ...Soldiers! Kill the queen of Crimea! That girl is a traitor to Begnion!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Whoa, this isn't good! The Imperial Army is on the move. They're after Queen Elincia!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So much for imperial honor. Greil Mercenaries! Looks like we have our old job back! Protect Queen Elincia!

intro.speaker: Geoffrey
intro.line: Tch! I knew it! Follow me, my knights! We shall protect Her Majesty!

intro.speaker: Valtome
intro.line: Kill every living thing that stands in our way! Show them that I--no, the senate--controls this pathetic land!

intro.speaker: Sergei
intro.line: Of course, Senator Valtome! I'd be happy to kill the wench.

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: I'm glad you're safe. That was one crazy move you pulled.

battle-talk.speaker: Elincia
battle-talk.line: It's what I had to do to stop the fighting. However...my efforts have failed. I could not stop them.

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: But at least you made your point to the Laguz Alliance. I'm sure there are those in the Imperial Army who understand as well. You did the right thing.

battle-talk.speaker: Elincia
battle-talk.line: You're always so kind. Thank you, Sir Ike.

battle.speaker: Levail
battle.line: General Zelgius! Senator Valtome is about to run down the queen of Crimea!

battle.speaker: Zelgius
battle.line: That useless parasite. Attacking an unarmed woman... This is beneath even him.

battle.speaker: Levail
battle.line: The Crimean army and a part of the Laguz Alliance have joined battle in order to rescue the queen. They are fighting Senator Valtome. Shall we assist the senator?

battle.speaker: Zelgius
battle.line: Prepare to leave. We are not fighting.

battle.speaker: Levail
battle.line: But, General... That would mean that we abandoned Duke Culbert's force...

battle.speaker: Zelgius
battle.line: I will take all responsibility for this. Make my command clear to all of the men. I will not accept more units joining this fight!

battle.speaker: Begnion
battle.line: Commander! Our force is taking heavy losses! Defeat is imminent. Even our strike force cannot keep the enemy at bay! Please, you must escape!

battle.speaker: Valtome
battle.line: I've been defeated? Me? By worthless rabble like this?! Ugh, blast that Zelgius! How dare he not assist me! I'll have his pompous head for this!

boss.speaker: Sergei
boss.line: Fools! How dare you fight my master? He is Senator Valtome, duke of Culbert! Die in his name!

boss.speaker: Sergei
boss.line: We are under the direct orders of Senator Valtome! His words carry the weight of the entire senate! Mercenaries! You know how war works. You know that Begnion can pay--

boss.speaker: Ike
boss.line: Save your breath. The Greil Mercenaries choose our employers. All the wealth in the senate couldn't buy us. Lay down your bow and surrender.

boss.speaker: Sergei
boss.line: What?! Wretched fool! You'll rot in the ground next to that treacherous girl.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Phew... Begnion's finally given up! That took some doing.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Tell me about it. But we did get some good information out of all this. Now we know for certain that there are serious leadership problems in the Imperial Army. I'm glad General Zelgius was honorable enough to withdraw. If the full strength of the two armies had clashed, Elincia's effort would've been wasted.

end.speaker: Geoffrey
end.line: Sir Ike! Sir Ranulf! Thank you for helping us save Queen Elincia.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Geoffrey. I'm really surprised you let Elincia do such a dangerous thing. You must be more relaxed these days.

end.speaker: Geoffrey
end.line: It wasn't easy for me, as you could guess. But I can never really say no to Queen Elincia. What choice did we have, anyway?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You didn't have any, and you all did what needed to be done. I'm really impressed. Crimea's become quite strong.

end.speaker: Geoffrey
end.line: Don't talk like such a stranger. The Greil Mercenaries are also from Crimea. You're part of that strength.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: True. I'm very proud of my homeland.

end.speaker: Geoffrey
end.line: Let's go see Her Majesty. You do have time to speak with her, right?

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: I shall now dispense punishment for disobeying my orders! General Zelgius! Do you have anything to say? I would hear your pleas now.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: ...I am prepared to face the consequences of my actions.

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: Quite an admirable sentiment, General. Although I imagine you should have thought about the consequences before you abandoned your allies! Now, on your knees. It's time for your execution. Good-bye, General Zelgius.

end.speaker: Levail
end.line: Wh-what?! Senator! I must ask you to reconsider! To execute a man of General Zelgius's caliber without a trial... It's madness! It's horrible!

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: Levail, are you questioning a senator? A senator holds the right to punish a prisoner however he sees fit! Oh, I'll make sure to tell our people that the general was cut down in battle after felling hundreds of sub-humans. That way, the people will not trouble themselves over details that they couldn't possibly understand.

end.speaker: Levail
end.line: You would bury the truth?! Do you think the apostle is as easily fooled by your lies?!

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: Oh, I sincerely doubt the apostle will ever get to hear them. ...All right, I've waited long enough. Your wait is over as well, Zelgius. Execute him!

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: Don't worry, Zelgius. I'll make sure that your lands are looked after. They'll be mine, of course. Uwee hee hee!

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: What?!
Silence, Valtome! All soldiers loyal to Begnion are to stand down immediately!

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: Hello, Senator Valtome.

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: You...! You're one of the Holy Guards!

end.speaker: Tanith
end.line: The apostle will be here shortly! Soldiers, sheathe your weapons and kneel before the apostle!

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: What?! No... It's impossible!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: Ah! It's her! There's no doubt about it!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: It's the apostle! The apostle is here!

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: ... My soldiers. I apologize for my sudden disappearance.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: I am here today to explain things, and to bring you news from home that is of the utmost importance. My soldiers, listen to me carefully. I never wished for this war. It was started by those who wanted me dead. It was spurred on by their desire to rule Begnion for themselves. This war was the work of the senate and was organized by Vice-Minister Lekain of Gaddos!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: The senate wished harm upon the apostle?!

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: No... Impossible! How can that be?

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: ...Lies! She lies! Do not be tricked, proud soldiers of Begnion! She is not the true apostle!

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Ah, I see. Then we are not the real Holy Guards? Is that what you are trying to say?

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: N-no! This is a farce! You cannot trick us! You are using a fake apostle to disable the senate and take over Begnion! Men, we must act! That vile Sephiran is their leader! The fact that he's been put in chains is our proof!

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: Hurk!

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: ...I will not allow you to disgrace my master's good name. One more syllable and I shall snap your neck, Valtome.

end.speaker: Valtome
end.line: Urk...! Ahh!

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: Apostle. Words cannot express how good it is to see you alive and well. We have been awaiting your return.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Thank you, General Zelgius. You and I have much to discuss.

narration: Apostle Sanaki arrives without warning at the Central Army's main camp in Crimea. With a strength born of conviction, she exposes the senators' vile plot to undermine and usurp her.

Valtome counterattacks with a claim crafted by the senate--that the apostle is a fraud who, along with her prime minister, Sephiran, is attempting to deceive all of Begnion and lead them away from the goddess's graces. To the citizens of Begnion, the senators are chosen by the goddess and are worthy of the same respect given to the apostle. As for the apostle, her image is tarnished when the senate imprisons Prime Minister Sephiran in her name.

An ever-growing number of Begnion's citizens are willing to believe the senators' claim that the apostle is an agent of evil trying to deceive them. So it is that the Central Army is divided. One camp believes in the apostle, and the other supports the senate. This new turmoil fans the flames of chaos into a mighty conflagration, burning across Tellius.

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: Welcome back, you two.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Giffca. Apologies for worrying you.

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: You persevered through many difficult battles. We are glad to have you back in one piece.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Each and every soldier in the army helped me. I couldn’t do anything by myself. Alone, I was powerless.

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: That’s good. If that’s what you learned from this campaign, then it wasn’t a wasted effort for Gallia. Good work, Ranulf.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Thank you, sir.

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: Skrimir, come here. I have something from the king.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: What is this?

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: It’s a satori sign. It is said to bring out the hidden power of the laguz.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Amazing!

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: Here, it’s yours.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Ranulf. You should take it.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: What? Why? The king said it was for you!

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Yes, but you’ve been looking after me. It’s… a sign of my appreciation.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Skrimir…

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: Very well. Ranulf. This is yours to keep.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: A-all right. Thank you, sir.

conversation.speaker: Giffca
conversation.line: Skrimir, you reply to his thanks.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Um, yes. You’re welcome. I am grateful for your continued support.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Of course, General.
